sentences.en: A child's great recourse in trouble is its mother.
sentences.cn: 在窘困的时候,小孩子的有力保护人是他的母亲.

sentences.en: An occasional recourse to philosophical or mystical doctrines succeeded in cloaking some difficulties.
sentences.cn: 偶尔求助于哲学的或者神秘的教义已经成功地掩盖了一些困难.

sentences.en: His last recourse was the law.
sentences.cn: 他最后的绝招是诉诸法律.

sentences.en: I couldn't tell which direction without recourse to a map.
sentences.cn: 不借助地图我就无法说清方位.

sentences.en: It enabled its members to settle their differences without recourse to war.
sentences.cn: 这样，其成员就可以不必诉诸战争来解决分歧。

sentences.en: Kentuck had recourse to his finger.
sentences.cn: 肯塔克灵机一动想起了自己的手指.

sentences.en: My only recourse -- and my instinct -- was to fight back.
sentences.cn: 我唯一可以采取的办法 -- 同时也是我的本能 -- 是反击.

sentences.en: Our recourse in illness is to a doctor.
sentences.cn: 患病时我们求助于医生.

sentences.en: Recourse to arms was open to them.
sentences.cn: 他们可循借助武器的途径.

sentences.en: Surgery may be the only recourse.
sentences.cn: 手术可能是唯一的办法。

sentences.en: The army adamantly refused and insisted that there was no recourse but war.
sentences.cn: 陆军坚决拒绝,并坚持除战争外别无它路.

sentences.en: The enemy may have recourse to steel instead of poison.
sentences.cn: 敌人可能用凶器来取代放毒.

sentences.en: The sick man had recourse to drugs to lessen his pain.
Thought has recourse to ultimate principle and ideas.
sentences.cn: 思想求助于终极的原则与观念.

sentences.en: We may conclude that he never had recourse to this simple experiment.
sentences.cn: 我们也许可以断定，他根本就没有试过这个简单的实验。

sentences.en: Your only recourse is legal action.
sentences.cn: 你的唯一依靠就是诉诸法律。

words.tran_cn: 求援，求助；[经]追索权；依赖；救生索

phrases.tran_cn: (财政)无追索权（为未来无力支付时拒赔的程式用语，尤指可转让金融证券）

trans.tran_cn: 求援，追索权，依赖，所依靠的物[人]
trans.tran_en: something that you do to achieve something or deal with a situation, or the act of doing it
